title: Building a Scalable Data Pipeline
description: Designing fault-tolerant ETL pipelines with Airflow, schema evolution, and production observability instrumentation.
body:
A deep-dive into designing fault-tolerant ETL pipelines using modern tooling. We explore orchestration with Airflow, schema evolution strategies, and how to instrument jobs for production observability.

Key topics covered: pipeline idempotency, backfill strategies, SLAs, and cost optimisation on cloud compute.

title: Demystifying Gradient Boosting
description: From bias-variance tradeoff to XGBoost hyperparameter tuning — a practical guide to boosting ensembles.
body: From bias-variance tradeoff to XGBoost hyperparameter tuning: a practical guide to understanding how boosting ensembles learn, where they fail, and how to debug your model step by step.

title: SQL Window Functions Explained
description: RANK, LAG, LEAD and NTILE with real-world business cases and annotated SQL examples.
body: Window functions like RANK, LAG, LEAD and NTILE unlock powerful analytical queries without collapsing your result set. This post walks through real-world business cases with annotated SQL.

title: Reproducible Research with Python
description: Structure projects with Cookiecutter, DVC, and MLflow for guaranteed reproducibility end-to-end.
body: Notebooks are great for exploration but terrible for collaboration. Learn how to structure your projects using Cookiecutter, DVC, and MLflow to guarantee reproducibility from data ingestion to model artefacts.

title: Data Strategy for Growing Startups
description: The minimal viable data stack that lets a 10-person startup move like a 100-person organisation.
body: When you don't have a data team yet, every decision compounds. This post covers the minimal viable data stack — from event tracking to a first data warehouse — that lets a 10-person team move like a 100-person one.

title: Data Storytelling with Python
description: Applying Gestalt principles and narrative structure to build executive-ready data visualisations.
body: Charts lie when we let them. Learn how to choose the right visualisation type, apply Gestalt principles for pre-attentive processing, and craft a clear narrative that an executive can act on in under 30 seconds.

title: CI/CD for Machine Learning Models
description: Model versioning, shadow deployments, canary rollouts, and automated performance regression tests.
body: Deploying a model once is easy. Maintaining it over 12 months is not. This guide covers model versioning, shadow deployments, canary rollouts, and automated performance regression tests.

title: Causal Inference for Analysts
description: DiD, IV, and RD designs that let you draw causal conclusions from observational data.
body: Correlation is not causation — but sometimes we need to act as if it is. Learn how Difference-in-Differences, Instrumental Variables, and Regression Discontinuity let you draw causal conclusions from observational data.

title: Breaking into Data Science in 2025
description: What hiring managers actually look for: production code, communication, and domain fluency.
body: The market has shifted. Generalist roles are down; specialised roles are up. This post distills what hiring managers actually look for: production code, communication skills, and domain fluency — not just model accuracy on Kaggle.

title: dbt: The Analyst's Best Friend
description: Version-controlled models, automated tests, and lineage graphs — from ad-hoc SQL to collaborative data modelling.
body: dbt turns SQL into a software engineering practice: version-controlled models, automated testing, lineage graphs, and self-documenting warehouses. A practical walkthrough for analysts moving from ad-hoc queries to collaborative data modelling.
